title: Merit Badges for Broadening Cryo-EM Access and Training at NCCAT
content: The National Center for Cryo-EM Access and Training (NCCAT) is one of three cryo-EM service centers in the US established by the NIH Common Fund in 2017 [1]. The primary goal of NCCAT is to provide access to and training in the latest cryo-EM technology and best practices to academic scientists at no cost at the point of access. Categories of access to the resources at NCCAT include General User Proposals for data collection on high-end instrumentation, blot-free vitrification with the chameleon, and grid preparation and screening; and Training Proposals for personalized embedded cross-training or facility manager training [2].
